data.title: patch: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Patch is a distinctive name that is used as a diminutive and an independent name. Explore more about the name here.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Patch

Patch is a masculine name with multiple origins. In English, it is a variant of Peter which is derived from the Greek name Petros, meaning ‚Äúrock‚Äù or ‚Äústone.‚Äù It is also a variant of Pask from Middle English ‚ÄúPaske,‚Äù which meant ‚ÄúEaster Passover.‚Äù

Some speculate that Patch is a name of Greek and German origins, where it means ‚Äústone‚Äù or ‚Äú fight.‚Äù It may be related to the names Peter and Pazzo and can simply be an alternative spelling of the German names Patsch or Petsch. The name is also considered to be the Americanized form of Czech and Slovak Paƒç. Another meaning that is associated with the name Patch is ‚Äúnoble.‚Äù

The name is primarily used as a surname, but it can also be used as a given name albeit rare. It was used as a personal name for someone born at Easter and is also thought to be an occupational surname for someone who mended clothing patches. Patch is pronounced as ‚Äúpat-ch‚Äù with a short ‚Äúa‚Äù sound. In some regions, however, it may be pronounced as ‚Äúp(a)-tch‚Äù with a long ‚Äúa‚Äù sound.

Notable personalities with this name include General Alexander McCarrell Patch, a senior US Army officer who fought in both world wars. Patch Adams is an American physician, social activist, comedian, and author who founded the Gesundheit Institute in 1971. Harry Patch is an English supercentenarian, also known as the ‚ÄúLast fighting Tommy.‚ÄùHe was the last surviving trench combat soldier of the World War I. Horace Patch is an American politician who recruited and captained the 16th Wisconsin Volunteer Infantry Regiment during the American Civil War. The name finds mention in popular culture as well. Patch Johnson is a fictional character from Days of Our Lives.

Patch On The Popularity Chart

Patch‚Äôs popularity saw fluctuations over the years. Find out the popularity and ranking trends of the name from the graphs below.

Popularity Over Time

The name was not a popular choice among parents with only five babies per million named Patch in the years 2012, 2013, and 2021.

Source:

Rank Over Time

The name Patch has not fared well on the popularity charts. It was ranked 33,214, 32,804, and 31,014 in 2012, 2013, and 2021, respectively.

Source:

A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Patch‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Patch‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Patch Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Patch is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Patch‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
